# Apache OpenDALâ„¢: One Layer, All Storage.

> OpenDAL (/ËˆoÊŠ.pÉ™n.dÃ¦l/, pronounced "OH-puhn-dal") is an Open Data Access Layer that enables seamless interaction with diverse storage services.

OpenDAL's development is guided by its vision of One Layer, All Storage and its core principles: Open Community, Solid Foundation, Fast Access, Object Storage First, and Extensible Architecture. Read the explained vision at OpenDAL Vision.

## Table of Contents

### Docs

- [Welcome to Apache OpenDALâ„¢ | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/): OpenDAL represents Open Data Access Layer. Our vision is One Layer, All Storage.
- [Core | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/core/)
- [Apache OpenDALâ„¢ Downloads | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/download/): The official Apache OpenDAL releases are provided as source artifacts.
- [Vision | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/vision/): Charter
- [Apps migration guide | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/apps/migration/): This repository no longer maintains the applications Oli and Ofs.
- [Oay (removed) | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/apps/oay/): This tool has been removed from the Apache OpenDAL repository.
- [Ofs (moved) | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/apps/ofs/): Ofs has moved to a separate repository and is no longer maintained in this repository.
- [Oli (moved) | Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/apps/oli/): Oli has moved to a separate repository and is no longer maintained in this repository.

### Blog

- [reqsign is now Apache OpenDAL Reqsign](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/2025/09/15/apache-opendal-reqsign/): Iâ€™m happy to announce that my personal project has been donated to the ASF and accepted by the Apache OpenDAL PMC as a subproject: Apache OpenDAL Reqsign. This means Reqsign will now be governed by the Apache OpenDAL PMC under the Apache Way.
- [Apache OpenDAL 2025 Roadmap: Perfecting Production Adoption](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/2025/03/01/2025-roadmap/): Hi everyone, long time no see. Although we have been actively developing OpenDAL and consistently releasing updates, we havenâ€™t provided a clear overview of where OpenDAL is heading. This post aims to address that. Here, we will discuss OpenDAL's current position and the future directions we are moving toward.
- [Apache OpenDALâ„¢ Beijing Meetup 1st](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/2024/09/09/apache-opendal-meetup-beijing-1st/): Hello, everyone!
- [Apache OpenDALâ„¢ participates in Open Source Promotion Plan 2024](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/apache-opendal-participates-in-ospp-2024/): Hello, everyone!
- [Apache OpenDALâ„¢ participates in Google Summer of Code 2024](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/apache-opendal-participates-in-gsoc-2024/): Hello, everyone!
- [Apache OpenDALâ„¢ is now Graduated](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/apache-opendal-graduated/): Hello, everyone! I'm happy to announce that Apache OpenDALâ„¢ has graduated from the Apache Incubator to become a Top-Level Project of the Apache Software Foundation.
- [OwO #1: The v0.40 Release](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/owo-1/): OwO (Outcome, Working, Outlook) is an Apache OpenDALâ„¢ release blog series, where we share the current work status and future plans.
- [Apache OpenDALâ„¢ Internal: Data Reading](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/how-opendal-read-data/): The first article will discuss OpenDAL's most commonly used data reading function. I will start from the outermost interface and then gradually unfold according to the calling sequence of OpenDAL.
- [Apache OpenDALâ„¢: Access Data Freely](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/opendal-access-data-freely/): If you're committed to building cloud-native, cross-cloud-first applications and services, or you want to support configurable storage backends to meet complex data access needs, or if you're tired of juggling various SDKs and hoping for a unified abstraction and development experience, Apache OpenDALâ„¢ will be your perfect partner.
- [Way to Go: OpenDAL successfully entered Apache Incubator](https://opendal.apache.org/blog/opendal-entered-apache-incubator/): On February 27th, 2023, the OpenDAL project achieved a milestone by winning the approval to join the incubator of the Apache Software Foundation (ASF), the world's leading open source software organization. On March 15th, the OpenDAL project was officially transferred to the Apache Software Foundation.

### Community

- [Onboarding](https://opendal.apache.org/community/committers/onboarding): This document primarily serves as a guide for new committers to Apache OpenDALâ„¢.
- [Request for adding secrets](https://opendal.apache.org/community/committers/request_for_adding_secrets): OpenDAL's behavior tests depend on the secrets stored in 1password.
- [GSoC Project Proposal Guidance](https://opendal.apache.org/community/events/gsoc-proposal-guide): This document contains a short guide on how to structure your OpenDAL Google Summer of Code (GSoC) project proposal and how to increase the chance of your project proposal being accepted.
- [OSPP Project Proposal Guidance](https://opendal.apache.org/community/events/ospp-proposal-guide): This document contains a short guide on how to structure your OpenDAL Open Source Promotion Plan (OSPP) project proposal and how to increase the chance of your project proposal being accepted.
- [Community](https://opendal.apache.org/community/category/committers): Welcome to the Apache OpenDALâ„¢ community!
- [Maturity Assessment for Apache OpenDALâ„¢](https://opendal.apache.org/community/maturity): The goals of this maturity model are to describe how Apache projects operate in a concise and high-level way, and to provide a basic framework that projects may choose to use to evaluate themselves.
- [Board reporting](https://opendal.apache.org/community/pmc_members/board-reporting): Apache PMC members are responsible for reporting the status of their projects to the Apache Board of Directors. This page provides guidance on how to prepare and submit reports for Apache OpenDALâ„¢.
- [Nominate Committer](https://opendal.apache.org/community/pmc_members/nominate-committer): This document mainly introduces how a PMC member nominates a new committer.
- [Nominate PMC Member](https://opendal.apache.org/community/pmc_members/nominate-pmc-member): This document mainly introduces how a PMC member nominates a new PMC member.
- [Onboarding](https://opendal.apache.org/community/pmc_members/onboarding): This document primarily serves as a guide for new PMC members to Apache OpenDALâ„¢.
- [Generate release note](https://opendal.apache.org/community/release/reference/generate_release_note): This document describes how to generate release notes using GitHub:
- [Setup GPG key](https://opendal.apache.org/community/release/reference/setup_gpg): This section is a brief from the Cryptography with OpenPGP guideline.
- [Create a release](https://opendal.apache.org/community/release): This document mainly introduces how the release manager

- [Security](https://opendal.apache.org/community/security): The Apache Software Foundation takes a rigorous stance on eliminating security issues in its software projects. Likewise, Apache OpenDALâ„¢ is also vigilant and takes security issues related to its features and functionality into the highest consideration.
